name: Fake Shopping Website Lab
summary: Browse a too-good-to-be-true shopping website with massive discounts. Will you spot the signs of a scam before entering your card details?

traps.description: You clicked 'Buy Now' on an unrealistic 90% discount without verifying the seller.
You added items to cart on an unverified website.
You proceeded to checkout on a suspicious website.
You entered your full card details including CVV on an untrusted website.
You submitted payment without inspecting the website's URL or certificate.
You inspected the URL and certificate details before proceeding.

realWorldConsequences: Scammers could charge your card multiple times or sell your card details to criminals.
You may never receive any product, or receive a cheap counterfeit instead.
Your card details could be used for unauthorized purchases across multiple merchants.
You have no recourse – fake websites disappear within days, making chargebacks difficult.
Your address and personal details could be sold to other scammers for future attacks.
preventionTips: If a discount seems too good to be true (70-90% off branded items), it almost certainly is.
Check for a clear 'About Us' page, physical address, GST number, and customer service contact.
Search for the website name + 'scam' or 'review' before buying from unknown sites.
Use trusted payment gateways like Razorpay, PayU, or PayTM that offer buyer protection.
A padlock (HTTPS) only means the connection is encrypted – it doesn't mean the site is legitimate.
Read reviews carefully – fake reviews often use repetitive phrases and perfect 5-star ratings.

redFlagHints.rushed-to-buy: The huge discount (90% off a ₹79,999 phone for ₹1,999) and countdown timer are designed to make you act without thinking.
redFlagHints.added-to-cart: Adding to cart on unverified sites commits you psychologically to completing the purchase.
redFlagHints.started-checkout: Legitimate e-commerce sites have well-known payment processors – be suspicious of direct card entry forms.
redFlagHints.submitted-card-details: Never enter CVV on unfamiliar sites. Legitimate merchants use secure payment gateways.
redFlagHints.ignored-url-bar: Always check the domain name. 'superdeal-mart.in' is not a known retailer. Also check when the domain was registered.
redFlagHints.inspected-url: You correctly checked the URL details – this is a crucial security habit.
